channel.title: Need help decompiling a cache in a client
channel.description: I have permission from the owners of a server to use customs from their server but I have to decompile their cache to get the stuff. I downloaded jad decompiler but the cmd pops up real quick then disappears. Could anyone help me please?

item.title: Need help decompiling a cache in a client
item.dc:creator: @Nerdaz Nerdaz
item.description:
@Nerdaz wrote:

Decompressing the cache sounds the most promising…Do you know any tools you would recommend?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help decompiling a cache in a client

item.title: Need help decompiling a cache in a client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Nerdaz, post:3, topic:425489”]Well looks like they were lying to me then.
They said it was possible.
If there is a way to do it somehow I really need to know how.[/quote]

The way to achieve what you are describing is either decompile their ItemDefinition or Class8 class, get the values, copy the model, and add that data to your client, or (hopefully) if it’s packed in the cache, then you have to either decompress the cache, copy the data from obj.dat and data.dat (I believe) or, when the Items are being loaded, copy all the data during the loading process, and export it, then import it when the client starts up again.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help decompiling a cache in a client

[quote=“Nerdaz, post:1, topic:425489”]I have permission from the owners of a server to use customs from their server but I have to decompile their cache to get the stuff. I downloaded jad decompiler but the cmd pops up real quick then disappears.
Could anyone help me please?[/quote]

You can’t decompile the cache.
